message.content: This question requires basic knowledge about chemical reactions and heat. Heat can cause a chemical reaction by providing the energy needed for the reaction to occur. In this case, adding heat to cake batter can cause a chemical reaction, specifically the process of baking. Option (A) is incorrect because rocks do not typically undergo chemical reactions with heat. Option (B) is incorrect because while diamonds can be affected by heat, it does not cause a chemical reaction. Option (D) is incorrect because walls, typically made of inorganic materials like concrete or brick, will not undergo a chemical reaction with heat.

This question requires basic knowledge about chemical reactions and heat. When heat is added to cake batter, it can cause a chemical reaction called baking, which leads to the batter transforming into a cake. Option (A) is incorrect because rocks are not known to undergo chemical reactions when heat is added. Option (B) is incorrect because diamonds are made up of carbon and do not undergo chemical reactions when heat is added. Option (D) is incorrect because walls, typically made of building materials like concrete or bricks, do not undergo chemical reactions when heat is added.

This question requires basic knowledge about chemical reactions and the role of heat. Adding heat can cause a chemical reaction in cake batter because it can cause the ingredients to undergo a series of chemical changes, such as baking and rising, resulting in a cooked cake. Option (A) is incorrect because rocks are not typically involved in chemical reactions when heat is applied. Option (B) is also incorrect because while diamonds can be heated to change their properties, it does not involve a chemical reaction. Option (D) is incorrect because applying heat to a wall does not typically result in a chemical reaction.

Options (A), (B), and (D) are incorrect because heat does not typically cause chemical reactions in rocks, diamonds, or walls.
